s.text: Rosen's school flourished in the early-'90s recession, when newspapers were folding, budgets were being slashed, and the Net was a place for wizards to swap software wands.
To give this dialogue the semblance of a fair fight, allow me to delineate at least some things that I think Rosen and his allies get right.

Coverage of political issues too often gels around easy, conflict-based poles, to the detriment of anyone's understanding.
Again, there are exceptions, especially in small towns, but I think it's pretty rare to see community board meetings overflowing with local journalists out to better their neighborhoods.
